resources.string: Enter the time for one kilometer and calculate what is the speed:
Fill in the fields\nand calculate your BMI:
The most attractive women have BMI in the range
The most desirable BMI for men is between
Fill in the fields and calculate the maximum heart rate (HRmax):
Maximum heart rate for given values (depending on the method of calculation) is in the range:
The application contains multiple calendars that can be helpful in every runner\'s training.

At the beginning it is recommended to fill the basic data (gender, weight, height, age) in the program settings from the application menu. Details will be automatically saved in the form so it will not be necessary to enter them again.

Application settings collects Runner parameters, which will be used later to auto-complete data needed for calculations. There is no need to fill these data but this is recommended - it saves time and energy that can be used for example for running

BMI (Body Mass Index) is the ratio of body weight (given in kilograms) by the square of height (given in meters). By calculating BMI, we can determine the amount of body fat. When BMI is higher risk of many diseases (eg type II diabetes, hypertension, stroke, heart failure, coronary heart disease) is greater. But please note - BMI is rather imprecise indicator of overweight or the risk of diseases associated with it.

HRmax (maximal heart rate) is a heart rate telling the intensity when we (subjectively) feel that it is a maximum effort. Determination of maximum heart rate is used primarily to determine the areas of effort and is useful in training with heart rate monitor. The value of maximum heart rate is genetically determined and does not reflect the level of athletic. HRmax decreases with age and is generally higher for women. Please note that your maximum heart rate is different for each sport - for example in swimming, it is lower than in the running. Everything depends on the number of muscles involved in the effort. There are several models to determining the maximum heart rate. Sally Edwards model is most accurately determines the maximum heart rate. However, note that each of the models can be quite significant fault tolerance, and using the direct method is much better. Direct method involves making a maximum effort (preferably in competition), but for this you need a heart rate monitor.

The calculator converts pace to speed. In running we have pace in min/km (the number of minutes per kilometer) not speed in km/h (kilometers per hour) or mph (number of miles per hour). We find pace in the results of the competition, in heart rate monitor or applications like Endomondo. If we want to find out how speed we have in training or in the competition simply just use this calculator.

The calculator shows the probable times what can be achieved by the Runners during competitions at various distances. Calculations are performed using the model of Peter Riegel, which takes into account gender and time achieved when running on a given distance. Please note that the calculations are not accurate - it is only theoretical results, which may differ from reality because they do not take into account many important data (condition strength, etc.).
Calculate time that you reach on the competition
Fill in the fields and calculate time that you reach on the competition
Table of expected times for specific distances:
Enter Resting Heart Rate and HRmax then click Calculate
Check your target heart rate for running

Continuous run in the first intensity. In the Polish school of training, it is easy run, faster than a jog but slower than BC2. At this intensity is most long distance run. BC1 is also called a conversational pace, because it is so slow that it allows you to free conversation in running time. Heart rate during the BC1 stands at 65–79% HRmax. This is the primary measure training for all runners.

Continuous run in the second intensity. In the Polish school of training, it is run at a medium pace, slower than the BC3, but faster than BC1. Running on this intensity is quite fast, but not much tiring. It is the intensity which can be easily maintained for 60–90 minutes in a training or longer during the competition. Talking during a run at this zone is difficult, but possible, an indication of heart rate during a run is about 75–85% of HRmax.

Continuous run in the third intensity. In the Polish school of training, it is fast long-distance run. Run is so fast that it doesn\'t allow conversation, shortness of breath is a large, heart rate is around 85–95% HRmax. It is a heavy training measure, used by advanced runners.

Beginning-level aerobic training. Reduces stress. The lowest level you can exercise in and still increase fitness levels. For beginners or people who have not training for a long period of time. This zone can be for just improving your overall health. It can also be a good recovery zone for people who are over-training and need to take a break. This mode is also good for people who want to lose weight as the main source of fuel used by the body is fat stores.

Basic cardiovascular training. Good recovery pace. This is the target heart rate zone where the heart begins to benefit. Training in this zone will begin improve your hearts ability to pump blood and improve the muscle cells ability to utilize oxygen. In this zone stored body fat is the primary source of energy utilized hence this zone is referred to as the weight management zone. This is a good zone for long slow distance exercise as the body becomes more efficient at feeding the working muscles more efficiently especially with fat as the main fuel source.

Improved aerobic capacity. Optimal cardiovascular training. This zone is the most effective for overall cardiovascular fitness and is often called the "aerobic zone" or "target heart rate zone". This is the optimal zone to workout in to increase your cardio-respitory capacity or the bodies ability to transport oxygenated blood to the muscle cells and carbon dioxide away from the cells. After a while you will be able to cover more distance during workouts in less time. Your body will burn less glucose and more stored fat as fuel thereby working more efficiently. This zone is also effective for increasing overall muscle strength.

Improved anaerobic capacity and threshold. Improved speed. This level is where you cross over from aerobic training to anaerobic training which is called the anaerobic threshold or AT. This is the point where the body cannot effectively remove lactic Acid from the working muscles quickly enough. Lactic Acid is a by product of glycogen consumption by the working muscles. This zone is primarily for people who want to increase their performance levels. You would characterize this zone as hard. During this zone your muscles are tired, your breathing is heavy and your fatigued. The benefit of training in this zone is you can increase your bodies ability to tolerate and deal with lactic acid for a longer period of time as the enzymes in your muscles responsible for anaerobic metabolism are increased. For competitors it is good to know your anaerobic threshold as many fit athletes can compete at or about their anaerobic threshold.

Anaerobic and muscular endurance. Increased power. You will only be able to train in this target heart rate zone for short periods of time. You should not train at this level unless you are very fit. In this zone lactic acid develops very quickly as you are operating with oxygen debt to the muscles The value of training in this zone is you can increase your fast twitch muscle fibers which increase speed. You will not be able to stay at this level very long and should be used in intervals or sprinting work at the track.
Maximum heart rate (HRmax) must be higher than the resting heart rate.

The calculator calculates heart rate for each training zone. % HRmax calculated in a different way for each method. The Karvonen method include resting heart rate, forumla Polish school of training is simplified – the calculations need only HRmax.
* HRmax is calculate by The Polish school of training formula
* HRmax is calculate by Karvonen formula
